pullrequest.title: Allow IMU orientation specification in SDF. Add orientation specification of SphericalCoordinate world frame.

content.raw: I may be bike-shedding here, but what about `orientation_reference_frame` instead of `reference_frame_orientation` to emphasize that it's related to the orientation measurements?
content.html: I may be bike-shedding here, but what about orientation_reference_frame instead of reference_frame_orientation to emphasize that it's related to the orientation measurements?

pullrequest.title: Allow IMU orientation specification in SDF. Add orientation specification of SphericalCoordinate world frame.

content.html: sounds fine except this setting affects linear measurements too?...

pullrequest.title: Allow IMU orientation specification in SDF. Add orientation specification of SphericalCoordinate world frame.

content.raw: I thought it only affected the orientation. Shouldn't the linear measurements be expressed using the frame given by `<sensor><pose>` relative to the link frame?
content.html: I thought it only affected the orientation. Shouldn't the linear measurements be expressed using the frame given by <sensor><pose> relative to the link frame?

pullrequest.title: Allow IMU orientation specification in SDF. Add orientation specification of SphericalCoordinate world frame.

content.raw:
Can you remove the "imu_" prefix from "imu_localization"? It is already a child under `<imu>`, so the `imu` prefix feel redundant. 

This should probably be an element. Quoting from the www school "Use attributes only to provide information that is not relevant to the data." I think this attribute is data, correct?
content.html:
Can you remove the "imu_" prefix from "imu_localization"? It is already a child under <imu>, so the imu prefix feel redundant.

This should probably be an element. Quoting from the www school "Use attributes only to provide information that is not relevant to the data." I think this attribute is data, correct?
